response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9‑inch round cake pans, then set aside. In a large bowl whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and ½ teaspoon salt, ensuring even distribution for a smooth batter that will rise perfectly later.",
  "step2": "Combine wet ingredients in a separate bowl: melt 1 cup (225 g) unsalted butter, then stir in 1 ½ cups granulated sugar until creamy. Beat in 4 large eggs one at a time, followed by 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, mixing thoroughly after each addition to ensure rich flavor and moist texture.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the dry flour mixture to the wet butter‑sugar blend, stirring gently with a spatula. Pour in ¾ cup (180 ml) whole milk and ½ cup (120 ml) strong brewed coffee, folding until just combined; avoid over‑mixing to keep the crumb tender and airy for a delicious chocolate experience every bite.",
  "step4": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Tap pans lightly on the counter to release air bubbles. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean, indicating doneness and golden brown edges with aroma.",
  "step5": "Allow cakes to cool in pans for ten minutes, then turn onto a wire rack to cool completely. Meanwhile, prepare frosting: melt 200 g dark chocolate with ½ cup (115 g) butter over a double boiler, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat, whisk in 2 cups powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons cream.",
  "step6": "Spread a thin layer of frosting on the first cake layer, then place the second layer atop. Using a spatula, frost the top and sides generously, creating smooth or rustic swirls as desired. Garnish with chocolate shavings or fresh berries, slice, serve, and enjoy your decadent chocolate masterpiece with joy."
}
